com.phunware.analytics

Class PwAnalyticsModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.core.CoreModule
      • com.phunware.analytics.PwAnalyticsModule

  • public final class PwAnalyticsModule
extends com.phunware.core.CoreModule
    Get an instance of the PwAnalyticsModule to install into the Core session.
    See Also:

    This module can be used to send custom analytic events.

      • addEvent

        public static void addEvent(android.content.Context context,
            java.lang.String eventName)
        Add an event to the analytics queue. Analytics will only be sent once a threshold has been reached, a new session is created, or the events are manually flushed.
        Parameters:
        eventName - Name of the event.

      • addEvent

        public static void addEvent(android.content.Context context,
            java.lang.String eventName,
            java.lang.String eventNamespace)
        Add an event to the analytics queue. Analytics will only be sent once a threshold has been reached, a new session is created, or the events are manually flushed.

        Parameters:
        eventName - Name of the event.
        eventNamespace - The namespace of the analytic event. Used for custom event processing.

      • addEventWithParameters

        public static void addEventWithParameters(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String eventName,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Add an event with parameters to the analytics queue. Analytics will only be sent once a threshold has been reached, a new session is created, or the events are manually flushed.

        Parameters must follow these rules:

        • There may be no more than MAX_PARAMETER_COUNT parameters. Extra parameters will be ignored.
        • Each key or value that is longer than MAX_PARMETER_CHAR_LIMIT will be truncated.

        Parameters:
        context - Current Context
        eventName - Name of the event.
        parameters - String key / value parameters.

      • addEventWithParameters

        public static void addEventWithParameters(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String eventName,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                          java.lang.String eventNamespace)
        Add an event with parameters to the analytics queue. Analytics will only be sent once a threshold has been reached, a new session is created, or the events are manually flushed.

        Parameters must follow these rules:

        • There may be no more than MAX_PARAMETER_COUNT parameters. Extra parameters will be ignored.
        • Each key or value that is longer than MAX_PARMETER_CHAR_LIMIT will be truncated.

        Parameters:
        context - Current Context
        eventName - Name of the event.
        parameters - String key / value parameters.
        eventNamespace - The namespace of the analytic event. Used for custom event processing.

      • startTimedEvent

        public static void startTimedEvent(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.String eventName)
        Start a timed event. Calling startTimedEvent with the same eventName prior to endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String) will overwrite the previous start time.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - Name of the event to start.
        See Also:
        endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String), endTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context, String, java.util.Map)

      • startTimedEvent

        public static void startTimedEvent(android.content.Context context,
                   java.lang.String eventName,
                   java.lang.String eventNamespace)
        Start a timed event. Calling startTimedEvent with the same eventName prior to endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String) will overwrite the previous start time.

        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - Name of the event to start.
        eventNamespace - The namespace of the analytic event. Used for custom event processing.
        See Also:
        endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String), endTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context, String, java.util.Map)

      • startTimedEventWithParameters

        public static void startTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context context,
                                 java.lang.String eventName,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Start a timed event with parameters.

        Parameters must follow these rules:

        • There may be no more than MAX_PARAMETER_COUNT parameters. Extra parameters will be ignored.
        • Each key or value that is longer than MAX_PARMETER_CHAR_LIMIT will be truncated.

        Calling startTimedEvent with the same eventName prior to endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String) will overwrite the previous start time.

        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - Name of the event to start.
        parameters - String key / value parameters that should be sent with the event.
        See Also:
        endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String), endTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context, String, java.util.Map)

      • startTimedEventWithParameters

        public static void startTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context context,
                                 java.lang.String eventName,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                 java.lang.String eventNamespace)
        Start a timed event with parameters.

        Parameters must follow these rules:

        • There may be no more than MAX_PARAMETER_COUNT parameters. Extra parameters will be ignored.
        • Each key or value that is longer than MAX_PARMETER_CHAR_LIMIT will be truncated.

        Calling startTimedEvent with the same eventName prior to endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String) will overwrite the previous start time.

        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - Name of the event to start.
        parameters - String key / value parameters that should be sent with the event.
        eventNamespace - The namespace of the analytic event. Used for custom event processing.
        See Also:
        endTimedEvent(android.content.Context, String), endTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context, String, java.util.Map)

      • pauseTimedEvent

        public static void pauseTimedEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
        Pause a timed event. A timed event can be resumed by calling resumeTimedEvent(String). If an event is ended while still in a paused state then the paused time will be used as the end time. If an event is already paused then nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        eventName - Name of the event to pause.

      • resumeTimedEvent

        public static void resumeTimedEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
        Resume a timed event that was paused. A timed event can be paused by calling pauseTimedEvent(String). If an event is not paused then resuming it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        eventName - Name of the event to resume.

      • endTimedEvent

        public static void endTimedEvent(android.content.Context context,
                 java.lang.String eventName)
        End a timed event. The event will not be sent if its duration is less than one second long. This will do nothing if the event name cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - The name of the event to end and queue for flushing.

      • endTimedEvent

        public static void endTimedEvent(android.content.Context context,
                 java.lang.String eventName,
                 java.lang.String eventNamespace)
        End a timed event. The event will not be sent if its duration is less than one second long. This will do nothing if the event name cannot be found. If an event is ended while still in a paused state then the paused time will be used as the end time.
        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - The name of the event to end and queue for flushing.
        eventNamespace - The namespace of the analytic event. Used for custom event processing.

      • endTimedEventWithParameters

        public static void endTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context context,
                               java.lang.String eventName,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        End a timed event with new parameters. Passing in new parameters will replace the old parameters. The event will not be sent if its duration is less than one second long. This will do nothing if the event name cannot be found.

        Parameters must follow these rules:

        • Keys and values must be strings
        • There may be no more than MAX_PARAMETER_COUNT parameters. Extra parameters will be ignored.
        • Each key or value that is longer than MAX_PARMETER_CHAR_LIMIT will be truncated.

        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - The name of the event to end and queue for flushing.
        parameters - New string key / value parameters to set for the event.

      • endTimedEventWithParameters

        public static void endTimedEventWithParameters(android.content.Context context,
                               java.lang.String eventName,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                               java.lang.String eventNamespace)
        End a timed event with new parameters. Passing in new parameters will replace the old parameters. The event will not be sent if its duration is less than one second long. This will do nothing if the event name cannot be found. If an event is ended while still in a paused state then the paused time will be used as the end time.

        Parameters must follow these rules:

        • Keys and values must be strings
        • There may be no more than MAX_PARAMETER_COUNT parameters. Extra parameters will be ignored.
        • Each key or value that is longer than MAX_PARMETER_CHAR_LIMIT will be truncated.

        Parameters:
        context - Current context
        eventName - The name of the event to end and queue for flushing.
        parameters - New string key / value parameters to set for the event.
        eventNamespace - The namespace of the analytic event. Used for custom event processing.
